qas.question: What did a professor at the Peking University say about the handling of the earthquake?

answers.text: This is the first time [that] the Chinese media has lived up to international standards

qas.question: What did Myanmar block after Cyclone Nargis?
What did a Peking professor say about Chinese media coverage?
Who praised Chinese media coverage as being democratic?
In which previous catastrophe not live up to international standards?

context: Rescue efforts performed by the Chinese government were praised by western media, especially in comparison with Myanmar's blockage of <a1_0>foreign aid<a1_0/> during Cyclone Nargis, as well as China's previous performance during the <a4_0>1976 Tangshan earthquake<a4_0/>. China's openness during the media coverage of the Sichuan earthquake led a professor at the Peking University to say, “<a0_0>This is the first time [that] the Chinese media has lived <a2_0>up to international standards<a2_0/><a0_0/>”. <a3_0>Los Angeles Times<a3_0/> praised China's media coverage of the quake of being "democratic".
